snippet: Under Israeli rules the 34 parties running in the election are barred from buying television time, but are entitled to seven minutes of free airtime on each of the three main channels.
abstract: Israelis are being hit with concentrated burst of political television featuring candidates both real and spoofed during lead up to country's election; households tune in to political satire broadcasts at twice rate that they watch official political broadcasts.
lead_paragraph: Under Israeli rules the 34 parties running in the election are barred from buying television time, but are entitled to seven minutes of free airtime on each of the three main channels.

headline.seo: Israeli Candidates Make Their Cases on TV
headline.main: For Israeli TV Viewers, a Big Helping of Candidates, Both Real and Spoofed
headline.print_headline: For Israeli TV Viewers, a Big Helping Of Candidates, Both Real and Spoofed
